company.name: Time Warner Cable Inc.
company.business_description: Time Warner Cable Inc. advertises, markets, distributes, and sells video, high-speed data, digital telephone, and other telecommunications services.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. ยง 45(a); Section 615 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. ยง 1681m; and the Risk-Based Pricing Rule, 16 C.F.R. ยง 640.1 et seq.

complaint.factual_background: Time Warner Cable Inc. (TWC) provided cable, internet, and telephone services to consumers and extended credit by allowing them to defer payment. TWC retrieved consumer credit reports and required some prospective customers with less favorable credit histories to pay a deposit or the first month's bill in advance, while a substantial proportion of customers with better credit were not required to pay such deposits. From January 1, 2011 through at least March 5, 2013, TWC failed to provide the required risk-based pricing notices to consumers who were charged deposits based on information in their credit reports, in violation of the Risk-Based Pricing Rule.

counts.title: Violation of the Risk-Based Pricing Rule
counts.representation: TWC extended credit to consumers on material terms that are materially less favorable than the most favorable material terms available to a substantial proportion of its customers, based in whole or in part on its use of consumer reports
counts.fact: In numerous instances, TWC failed to provide notice to consumers that they were extended credit on material terms that are materially less favorable than the most favorable material terms available to a substantial proportion of TWC's customers
counts.conclusion: Failure to provide such notice to a consumer constitutes a violation of the Risk-Based Pricing Rule and unfair or deceptive acts or practices in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act
